header: Advice to the Young: Life is Short and Then You Die

verse: The Teacher was full of wisdom, and he taught the people with knowledge. He carefully considered many proverbs and carefully arranged them.
The Teacher sought to find delightful words, and he wrote what is uprightâ€”truthful words.
The words of the wise are like cattle goads; the collections of the sages are like pricks inflicted by one shepherd.
My son, be careful about anything beyond these things. For the writing of books is endless, and too much study is wearisome.
